"Control panel" tab
This tab contains settings responsible for what will be displayed in the registry control panel.
On the "Control panel" tab, configuration is done using the following parameters:
Setting
Purpose
Setting buttons on the control panel in the registry
Selecting an object of type "Setting buttons of the control panel in the registry", which fixes a set of preset buttons to be displayed in the
control-panel
of the registry in the specified sequence.
This parameter allows reusing the same setting object for different registries.
Adding custom buttons is done directly in
button settings
of the corresponding registry.
If changes are saved to an object that is used as a setting in other registries, the system will display a notification.
When click the "Ok" button, the edits made will be applied to all registries that use this object for setup.
Previously created objects are selected from the drop-down list, creating/viewing/editing an object is done via the parameter action menu.
Possibilities when opening an object profile
In the object profile there is a possibility to:
setting preset buttons;
setting the current object as a default object for all new registers. To do this, set a checkbox in the corresponding checkbox field.
The system will display a notification when saving:
When clicking the "Ok" button, the current object automatically becomes the default object for all new registries (the change does not apply to existing registries). The previously used default object is unchecked automatically.
If a registry with a configuration object set as default for all registries is transferred using
an update
, and a configuration object with the "Default for all registries" flag already exists in the production instance, this flag will be removed from the transferred object.
to view the list of registries in which this setting object is used. To do this, go to the "Registries" tab.
Search filed
Visibility of the search field on the right side of the control panel.
Modal window title when creating a new object
This parameter is not supported.
The method for displaying the object name in the modal window can be defined in the "Name display settings" parameter in the
instance visual settings
.
Title in the detail profile
Displaying the title in the detail profile (name of the object profile).
Button setup
To specify the full set of buttons in
control panel
for a particular registry, the buttons on the current tab can be set up.
The list of
preset buttons
is system, but they can be hidden if needed. In addition, the hint can be changed for some buttons.
More about preset buttons
This settings block defines the visibility of the following actions (buttons):
Add - creating an object (by default, the
button);
Edit - editing an object (by default, the
button);
Refresh – updating the data of the current registry (by default, the
button);

in the registry
can be
automatically updated

An exception is the
edit mode
- in this mode, all changes made to the object are saved after clicking the
button.
If the
system setting
"Save entered data when closing the object profile" is active, the
button
in the object profile
can be used to
clear pre-filled fields

Advanced search;
Reorder;
Show child types - enabling viewing the hierarchy of the current registry type in a dropdown list and allows switching to the registry of the selected object type.
If there are
actions
available for the registry, custom buttons can be added to the registry control panel. This is done by clicking on the Add button, then selecting an available action, icon, and specifying a hint for the button.
Regardless of the settings in the action itself, a custom button must be added to display in the registry.
The buttons display sequence is changed by dragging and dropping the rows (it is not allowed to mix preset and custom buttons).
Buttons may be displayed in the control panel, but may not be accessible to the user if the user does not have the appropriate access permissions:
the "Create" and "Copy" buttons are locked if there is no permission to "Create type instances";
the "Edit" button is locked if there is no permission to "Edit type instances";
the "Delete" button is locked if there is no permission to "Delete type instances".
After saving changes by clicking the
button, the registry will be updated according to the applied settings.
Control panel settings are saved in the object selected in the "Control panel button settings in the registry" parameter. The saved changes will be applied to all registries that use this button settings object.
When displaying the buttons of a registry added to an object’s visual as an object or child attribute (for example, using the
"Registry for multiselect attribute"
visual), the button visibility settings defined via
attribute options
take precedence.
